repay.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to pay back money that you have borrowed
repay.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Your mortgage will be repaid over 25 years.
I’ll repay you the money you lent me next week.
repay.translation[0].definitions[0].note: In everyday English, people usually say that someone pays money back rather than repays it:
I'll pay you back the money at the end of the week.
repay.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to do something for someone, or give them something, in return for helping you
repay.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: I’d like to buy them something to repay all their kindness.
How can we repay him for everything he’s done?
repay.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: if something repays your time, effort etc, it is worth the time or effort you have spent
